nodes.name: Split With Stratified Sampling
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data by Stratified Sampling.
nodes.details:
Split With Stratified Sampling, which is the preferred way to sample from populations with varing subpopulation sizes.

More details are available at : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/_modules/pyspark/sql/dataframe.html#DataFrame.sampleBy

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: keyInputCol
fields.title: Column Name
fields.description: column that defines strata

fields.name: fraction
fields.title: Fraction
fields.description: sampling fraction for each stratum. If a stratum is not specified, we treat its fraction as zero

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: random seed

nodes.name: H2ODRF
nodes.details:
Distributed Random Forest (DRF) is a powerful classification and regression tool. When given a set of data, DRF generates a forest of classification or regression trees, rather than a single classification or regression tree. Each of these trees is a weak learner built on a subset of rows and columns. More trees will reduce the variance. Both classification and regression take the average prediction over all of their trees to make a final prediction, whether predicting for a class or numeric value.

More details are available at : docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-science/drf.html

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: isResponseIsCategorical
fields.title: isResponseColIsCategorical
fields.description: it Specify a response column type(numeric or categorical). Separates the Classification and Regression

fields.name: ignore_const_cols
fields.title: Ignore Const Cols
fields.description: Specify whether to ignore constant training columns, since no information can be gained from them

fields.name: ignored_columns
fields.title: Ignored Columns
fields.description: Specify the column or columns to be excluded from the model (Optional, Python and Flow only)

fields.name: fold_column
fields.title: Fold Column
fields.description: Specify the column that contains the cross-validation fold index assignment per observation

fields.name: weights_column
fields.title: Weights Column
fields.description: Specify whether to ignore constant training columns, since no information can be gained from them (enabled by default)

fields.name: max_depth
fields.title: Max Depth
fields.description: Specify the maximum tree depth (defaults values to 20)

fields.name: min_rows
fields.title: Min Rows
fields.description: Specify the minimum number of observations for a leaf (nodesize in R)

fields.name: distribution
fields.title: Distribution
fields.description: Specify the distribution (i.e., the loss function),The options are AUTO, bernoulli, multinomial, gaussian, poisson, gamma, laplace, quantile, huber, or tweedie

fields.name: nfolds
fields.title: NFolds
fields.description: Specify the number of folds for cross-validation

fields.name: ntrees
fields.title: NTrees
fields.description: Specify the number of trees

fields.name: nbins
fields.title: NBins
fields.description: Specify the number of bins for the histogram to build, then split at the best point (Numerical/real/int only)

fields.name: nbins_top_level
fields.title: Nbins top level
fields.description: Specify the minimum number of bins at the root level to use to build the histogram (For numerical/real/int columns only)

fields.name: nbins_cats
fields.title: NBin Cats
fields.description: Specify the maximum number of bins for the histogram to build, then split at the best point (Categorical/enums only)

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: Specify the random number generator (RNG) seed for algorithm components dependent on randomization

fields.name: balance_classes
fields.title: Balance classes
fields.description: balance the class distribution (only applicable for classification)

fields.name: binomial_double_trees
fields.title: Binomial double trees
fields.description: Build twice as many trees (one per class), (Binary classification only)

fields.name: build_tree_one_node
fields.title: Build tree one node
fields.description: Enables to run on a single node

fields.name: calibrate_model
fields.title: Calibrate model
fields.description: Use Platt scaling to calculate calibrated class probabilities (Defaults to False)

fields.name: categorical_encoding
fields.title: Categorical encoding
fields.description: Specify one of the various encoding schemes for handling categorical features

fields.name: check_constant_response
fields.title: Check constant response
fields.description: Check if the response column is a constant value (enabled (default))

fields.name: class_sampling_factors
fields.title: Class sampling factors
fields.description: Specify the per-class (in lexicographical order) over/under-sampling ratios (Note that this requires balance_classes=true)

fields.name: col_sample_rate_change_per_level
fields.title: Col sample rate change per level
fields.description: Specify to change the column sampling rate as a function of the depth in the tree

fields.name: col_sample_rate_per_tree
fields.title: Col sample rate per tree
fields.description: Specify the column sample rate per tree (value can be from 0.0 to 1.0 and defaults to 1)

fields.name: min_split_improvement
fields.title: Col sample rate per tree
fields.description: Specifies the minimum relative improvement in squared error reduction in order for a split to happen (Optimal values would be in the 1e-10���1e-3 range

fields.name: custom_metric_func
fields.title: Custom metric func
fields.description: it specify a custom evaluation function (Optional)

fields.name: fold_assignment
fields.title: Fold Assignment
fields.description: Specify the cross-validation fold assignment scheme (Applicable only if a value for nfolds is specified and fold_column is not specified)

fields.name: histogram_type
fields.title: Histogram type
fields.description: Specify the type of histogram to use for finding optimal split points (By default (AUTO) DRF bins from min���max in steps of (max-min)/N)

fields.name: keep_cross_validation_predictions
fields.title: Keep CV Predictions
fields.description: Enable to keep the cross-validation prediction

fields.name: keep_cross_validation_fold_assignment
fields.title: Keep CV Fold Assignment
fields.description: Enable to preserve the cross-validation fold assignment

fields.name: max_after_balance_size
fields.title: MAx after balance size
fields.description: Specify the maximum relative size of the training data after balancing class counts (balance_classes must be enabled, value can be less than 1.0)

fields.name: max_hit_ratio_k
fields.title: Max hit ratio k
fields.description: Specify the maximum number (top K) of predictions to use for hit ratio computation ( Applicable to multi-class only)

fields.name: max_runtime_secs
fields.title: Max runtime secs
fields.description: Maximum allowed runtime in seconds for model training (Use 0 to disable)

fields.name: mtries
fields.title: Mtries
fields.description: Specify the columns to randomly select at each level

fields.name: sample_rate
fields.title: Sample rate
fields.description: Specify the row sampling rate (x-axis), (Note that this method is sample without replacement)

fields.name: sample_rate_per_class
fields.title: Sample rate per class
fields.description: Specifies that each tree in the ensemble should sample from the full training dataset using a per-class-specific sampling rate rather than a global sample factor (as with sample_rate)

fields.name: score_each_iteration
fields.title: Score Each Iteration
fields.description: it Enable to score during each iteration of the model training (Optional)

fields.name: score_tree_interval
fields.title: Score tree interval
fields.description: Score the model after every so many trees (Disabled if set to 0)

fields.name: stopping_rounds
fields.title: Stopping Rounds
fields.description: Stops training when the option selected for stopping_metric

fields.name: stopping_metric
fields.title: Stopping metric
fields.description: Specify the metric to use for early stopping

fields.name: stopping_tolerance
fields.title: Stopping tolerance
fields.description: Specify the relative tolerance for the metric-based stopping to stop training if the improvement is less than this value

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

nodes.name: H2OPCA
nodes.details:
Principal Components Analysis (PCA) is closely related to Principal Components Regression. The algorithm is carried out on a set of possibly collinear features and performs a transformation to produce a new set of uncorrelated features.

More details are available at : docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-science/pca.html

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: k
fields.title: K
fields.description: Specify the rank of matrix approximation (This can be a value from 1 to 9 and defaults to 1).

fields.name: ignored_columns
fields.title: Specify the column or columns to be excluded from the model

fields.name: ignore_const_cols
fields.title: Specify whether to ignore constant training columns (This option is enabled by default)

fields.name: max_iterations
fields.title: max_iterations
fields.description: Specify the number of training iterations (The value must be between 1 and 1e6 and the default is 1000)

fields.name: compute_metrics
fields.title: Compute Metrics
fields.description: Enable metrics computations on the training data

fields.name: impute_missing
fields.title: Impute Missing
fields.description: Specifies whether to impute missing entries with the column mean value

fields.name: pca_implementation
fields.title: PCA Implementation
fields.description: it Specify the implementation to use for computing PCA (via SVD or EVD)

fields.name: pca_method
fields.title: PCA Method
fields.description: Specify the algorithm to use for computing the principal components

fields.name: transform
fields.title: Transform
fields.description: Specify the transformation method for the training data

fields.name: use_all_factor_levels
fields.title: Use All Factor Levels
fields.description: Specify whether to use all factor levels in the possible set of predictors

nodes.name: ColumnFilter
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame that contains only the selected columns
